csharp_simple:
1using System;
2using System.Collections.Generic;
3​
4namespace TechnicalIndicators
5{
6 /// <summary>
7 /// Awesome Oscillator (AO)
8 /// </summary>
9 /// <remarks>
10 /// A momentum indicator used to measure market momentum.
11 /// Calculated as the difference between a 5-period and a 34-period SMA of the median price.
12 /// <list type="bullet">
13 /// <item><description>Median Price = (High + Low) / 2</description></item>
14 /// <item><description>AO = SMA(Median, 5) - SMA(Median, 34)</description></item>
15 /// </list>
16 /// </remarks>
17 public class AwesomeOscillator
18 {
19 public List<decimal?> Values { get; } = new();
20 private const int FastPeriod = 5;
21 private const int SlowPeriod = 34;
22​
23 public void Calculate(IEnumerable<CandleData> candles)
24 {
25 Values.Clear();
26 var candleList = new List<CandleData>(candles);
27 if (candleList.Count == 0) return;
28​
29 // Step 1: Calculate Median Prices
30 var midpoints = new List<decimal>();
31 foreach (var c in candleList)
32 midpoints.Add((c.High + c.Low) / 2.0m);
33​
34 // Step 2: Calculate SMAs and Difference
35 for (int i = 0; i < candleList.Count; i++)
36 {
37 if (i < SlowPeriod - 1)
38 {
39 Values.Add(null);
40 continue;
41 }
42​
43 decimal sumFast = 0;
44 for (int j = 0; j < FastPeriod; j++) sumFast += midpoints[i - j];
45
46 decimal sumSlow = 0;
47 for (int j = 0; j < SlowPeriod; j++) sumSlow += midpoints[i - j];
48​
49 Values.Add(sumFast / FastPeriod - sumSlow / SlowPeriod);
50 }
51 }
52​
53 public static List<decimal?> Calculate(IEnumerable<CandleData> candles)
54 {
55 var ao = new AwesomeOscillator();
56 ao.Calculate(candles);
57 return ao.Values;
58 }
59 }
60}
csharp_detailed:
1// =============================================================================
2// Logic Breakdown (AwesomeOscillator)
3// =============================================================================
4//
5// This document provides a "Deep Dive" into the internal logic of the
6// Awesome Oscillator (AO) technical indicator created by Bill Williams.
7// We explain *why* code is written this way and *how* data transforms
8// line-by-line, targeting programming beginners.
9//
10// [Core Concepts]
11//
12// 1. Median Price - The Balance Point
13// [Why] Use the midpoint of each bar as a fair representation of price.
14// [What] Median = (High + Low) / 2
15// [How] Simple arithmetic average of the bar's extremes.
16// This filters out open/close bias and focuses on the trading range.
17//
18// 2. Momentum Measurement - Fast vs Slow SMA
19// [Why] Compare short-term momentum (5 bars) to medium-term (34 bars).
20// [What] AO = SMA(Median, 5) - SMA(Median, 34)
21// [How] Positive AO = short-term stronger than medium-term (bullish).
22// [Visual]
23// Fast SMA rising faster → AO positive (buying pressure)
24// Fast SMA falling below → AO negative (selling pressure)
25//
26// 3. Fixed Parameters - Bill Williams' Standard
27// [Why] 5/34 periods are empirically tested by Williams.
28// [What] Constants, not configurable parameters.
29// [How] Hardcoded as const values for simplicity.
30//
31// =============================================================================
32​
33// -------------------------------------------------------------
34// Import Directives
35//
36// [Why]
37// These namespaces provide essential types for the indicator.
38//
39// [What]
40// - System: Core types like DateTime, decimal operations
41// - System.Collections.Generic: List<T>, IEnumerable<T> for collections
42// -------------------------------------------------------------
43using System;
44using System.Collections.Generic;
45​
46namespace TechnicalIndicators
47{
48 // =============================================================================
49 // Logic Explanation: OHLCV Data Container (CandleData)
50 //
51 // [Why] Candle data requires a standardized, immutable structure.
52 //
53 // [What] Encapsulates: Timestamp, Open, High, Low, Close, Volume
54 //
55 // [Who] All indicator calculations consume this structure.
56 //
57 // Why 'readonly record struct'?
58 // 1. Immutability: Price history should never be modified.
59 // 2. Value semantics: Equality based on values, not reference.
60 // 3. Performance: Stack allocation for efficiency.
61 // =============================================================================
62 public readonly record struct CandleData(DateTime Timestamp, decimal Open, decimal High, decimal Low, decimal Close, long Volume);
63​
64 // =============================================================================
65 // Logic Explanation: Awesome Oscillator Indicator Class
66 //
67 // [Why] AO reveals market momentum by comparing two time frames.
68 // Bill Williams created this as part of his "Trading Chaos" system.
69 //
70 // Trading signals:
71 // - Zero Line Cross: AO crosses above zero = bullish
72 // - Saucer: 3-bar pattern showing momentum shift
73 // - Twin Peaks: Divergence between price and AO
74 //
75 // [What] Calculates AO = SMA(5) of Median - SMA(34) of Median
76 //
77 // [Who] Traders following Bill Williams' methodology.
78 //
79 // [Visual]
80 // High ──┐
81 // ├──→ Median = (H+L)/2 ──→ FastSMA(5) ─┐
82 // Low ───┘ ├──→ AO = Fast - Slow
83 // ╰──→ SlowSMA(34)┘
84 // =============================================================================
85 public class AwesomeOscillator
86 {
87 // -------------------------------------------------------------
88 // Logic Explanation: Indicator Configuration (Public Properties)
89 //
90 // [Why]
91 // Expose the calculated values for external consumption.
92 // No period parameters - AO uses fixed 5/34 values.
93 //
94 // [What]
95 // Values: List of AO values, one per candle.
96 //
97 // [Who]
98 // Charting libraries display as histogram (green/red bars).
99 // Trading systems check for zero-line crossovers.
100 // -------------------------------------------------------------
101​
102 // -------------------------------------------------------------
103 // Variable Definition: AO Output Values
104 // public List<decimal?> Values { get; } = new();
105 //
106 // [Role]
107 // Stores calculated AO for each input candle.
108 // Positive = bullish momentum, Negative = bearish.
109 //
110 // [Type Choice]
111 // List<decimal?>: Nullable for warm-up period (first 33 bars).
112 // decimal: Precision for price-based calculation.
113 // -------------------------------------------------------------
114 public List<decimal?> Values { get; } = new();
115​
116 // -------------------------------------------------------------
117 // Variable Definition: Fast Period (Constant)
118 // private const int FastPeriod = 5;
119 //
120 // [Role]
121 // Short-term SMA lookback. Captures recent momentum.
122 // Bill Williams' recommended value.
123 //
124 // [Type Choice]
125 // const int: Never changes, compile-time optimization.
126 // Private: Internal implementation detail.
127 // -------------------------------------------------------------
128 private const int FastPeriod = 5;
129​
130 // -------------------------------------------------------------
131 // Variable Definition: Slow Period (Constant)
132 // private const int SlowPeriod = 34;
133 //
134 // [Role]
135 // Medium-term SMA lookback. Baseline for comparison.
136 // Bill Williams' recommended value.
137 //
138 // [Type Choice]
139 // const int: Never changes, compile-time optimization.
140 // 34 is a Fibonacci number often used in Williams' work.
141 // -------------------------------------------------------------
142 private const int SlowPeriod = 34;
143​
144 // =============================================================================
145 // Logic Explanation: Main Calculation Method
146 //
147 // [Why] This processes price data to produce AO values.
148 // Two-phase approach:
149 // Phase 1: Calculate Median Price for each bar
150 // Phase 2: Calculate dual SMA difference at each point
151 //
152 // [What] Takes candle data, outputs AO values.
153 //
154 // [How] Pre-compute medians, then sliding window SMA subtraction.
155 // =============================================================================
156 public void Calculate(IEnumerable<CandleData> candles)
157 {
158 // -------------------------------------------------------------
159 // Logic Step 1: State Reset
160 //
161 // [Why] (Intent)
162 // Clear previous results for recalculation.
163 // Ensures idempotent behavior.
164 //
165 // [How] (Logic)
166 // Call Clear() on the Values list.
167 // -------------------------------------------------------------
168 Values.Clear();
169​
170 // -------------------------------------------------------------
171 // Logic Step 2: Materialize Input
172 //
173 // [Why] (Intent)
174 // Enable random access to candle data.
175 //
176 // [How] (Logic)
177 // Convert IEnumerable to List.
178 // -------------------------------------------------------------
179 var candleList = new List<CandleData>(candles);
180​
181 // -------------------------------------------------------------
182 // Logic Step 3: Empty Input Guard
183 //
184 // [Decision]
185 // Is the input empty?
186 //
187 // [True Branch: Empty]
188 // Return immediately - nothing to calculate.
189 //
190 // [False Branch: Has data]
191 // Proceed with calculation.
192 // -------------------------------------------------------------
193 if (candleList.Count == 0) return;
194​
195 // =============================================================================
196 // PHASE 1: Median Price Calculation
197 //
198 // [Why] AO uses median price, not close price.
199 // Median = (High + Low) / 2 represents the balance point.
200 //
201 // [What] Pre-compute all medians for efficiency.
202 //
203 // [Visual]
204 // Candle: High=110, Low=100
205 // Median: (110 + 100) / 2 = 105
206 //
207 // High ─── 110
208 // ← Median = 105
209 // Low ──── 100
210 // =============================================================================
211​
212 // -------------------------------------------------------------
213 // Variable Definition: Median Price List
214 // var midpoints = new List<decimal>();
215 //
216 // [Role]
217 // Stores median price for each candle.
218 // Used for both Fast and Slow SMA calculations.
219 //
220 // [Type Choice]
221 // List<decimal>: Non-nullable, always has a value.
222 // -------------------------------------------------------------
223 var midpoints = new List<decimal>();
224​
225 // -------------------------------------------------------------
226 // Logic Step 4: Calculate All Median Prices
227 //
228 // [Why] (Intent)
229 // Pre-compute for O(N) instead of recalculating in nested loops.
230 //
231 // [How] (Logic)
232 // For each candle: Median = (High + Low) / 2
233 //
234 // [Visual]
235 // Iteration: c0 c1 c2 ...
236 // Median: [(H+L)/2, (H+L)/2, (H+L)/2, ...]
237 // -------------------------------------------------------------
238 foreach (var c in candleList) midpoints.Add((c.High + c.Low) / 2.0m);
239​
240 // =============================================================================
241 // PHASE 2: AO Calculation (Dual SMA Difference)
242 //
243 // [Why] Compare short-term momentum to medium-term baseline.
244 //
245 // [What] AO[i] = SMA(5 medians ending at i) - SMA(34 medians ending at i)
246 //
247 // [Visual]
248 // Index: 0 1 ... 32 33 34 35 ...
249 // Medians: [M0, M1, ..., M32, M33, M34, M35, ...]
250 // AO: [null, null,..., null, AO, AO, AO, ...]
251 // ↑
252 // First valid at SlowPeriod-1 = 33
253 //
254 // AO Histogram Visualization:
255 // +│ ██ ██
256 // │ ████ ████
257 // 0├──────────────────────
258 // │ ▄▄▄ ▄
259 // │ ▄▄▄▄▄ ▄▄
260 // -│ ████████
261 // └────────────────────→ Time
262 // ↑ Bearish ↑ Bullish
263 // =============================================================================
264 for (int i = 0; i < candleList.Count; i++)
265 {
266 // -------------------------------------------------------------
267 // Logic Step 5a: Warm-up Period Check
268 //
269 // [Decision]
270 // Do we have enough data for the slow SMA (34 periods)?
271 //
272 // [True Branch: Not enough (i < SlowPeriod - 1)]
273 // Output null - cannot calculate AO yet.
274 //
275 // [False Branch: Sufficient data]
276 // Proceed to calculate both SMAs and their difference.
277 //
278 // [Why SlowPeriod - 1?]
279 // At index 33, we have 34 values (0-33) for slow SMA.
280 // -------------------------------------------------------------
281 if (i < SlowPeriod - 1) { Values.Add(null); continue; }
282​
283 // -------------------------------------------------------------
284 // Variable Definition: SMA Accumulators
285 // decimal sumFast = 0, sumSlow = 0;
286 //
287 // [Role]
288 // sumFast: Accumulates last 5 median prices
289 // sumSlow: Accumulates last 34 median prices
290 //
291 // [Type Choice]
292 // decimal: Maintain precision through accumulation.
293 // Two separate accumulators for parallel computation.
294 // -------------------------------------------------------------
295 decimal sumFast = 0, sumSlow = 0;
296​
297 // -------------------------------------------------------------
298 // Logic Step 5b: Calculate Fast SMA (5 periods)
299 //
300 // [Why] (Intent)
301 // Short-term momentum: average of last 5 median prices.
302 //
303 // [How] (Logic)
304 // Sum medians from (i-4) to i, then divide by 5.
305 //
306 // [Visual]
307 // i = 36:
308 // Medians: [..., M32, M33, M34, M35, M36]
309 // └──────────────┘
310 // Fast window (5 bars)
311 // -------------------------------------------------------------
312 for (int j = 0; j < FastPeriod; j++) sumFast += midpoints[i - j];
313​
314 // -------------------------------------------------------------
315 // Logic Step 5c: Calculate Slow SMA (34 periods)
316 //
317 // [Why] (Intent)
318 // Medium-term baseline: average of last 34 median prices.
319 //
320 // [How] (Logic)
321 // Sum medians from (i-33) to i, then divide by 34.
322 //
323 // [Visual]
324 // i = 36:
325 // Medians: [M3, M4, ..., M32, M33, M34, M35, M36]
326 // └──────────────────────────────────┘
327 // Slow window (34 bars)
328 // -------------------------------------------------------------
329 for (int j = 0; j < SlowPeriod; j++) sumSlow += midpoints[i - j];
330​
331 // -------------------------------------------------------------
332 // Logic Step 5d: Calculate and Store AO
333 //
334 // [Why] (Intent)
335 // AO = Fast SMA - Slow SMA reveals momentum.
336 //
337 // [How] (Logic)
338 // Divide each sum by its period, then subtract.
339 // Positive = fast rising faster (bullish)
340 // Negative = fast falling faster (bearish)
341 //
342 // [Visual]
343 // FastSMA = 105.2, SlowSMA = 103.8
344 // AO = 105.2 - 103.8 = +1.4 (Bullish)
345 //
346 // Interpretation:
347 // AO > 0 + rising: Strong bullish
348 // AO > 0 + falling: Weakening bullish
349 // AO < 0 + falling: Strong bearish
350 // AO < 0 + rising: Weakening bearish
351 // -------------------------------------------------------------
352 Values.Add(sumFast / FastPeriod - sumSlow / SlowPeriod);
353 }
354 }
355​
356 // =============================================================================
357 // Logic Explanation: Static Convenience Wrapper
358 //
359 // [Why] Provide a one-liner API for simple use cases.
360 // No parameters needed - AO always uses 5/34.
361 //
362 // [What] Creates instance, calculates, returns results.
363 //
364 // [How] Three-step pattern: Instantiate → Execute → Extract
365 // =============================================================================
366 public static List<decimal?> Calculate(IEnumerable<CandleData> candles)
367 {
368 // -------------------------------------------------------------
369 // Logic Step 1: Instantiation
370 //
371 // [Why] (Intent)
372 // Create a new AO instance.
373 // No parameters - uses fixed 5/34 periods.
374 // -------------------------------------------------------------
375 var ao = new AwesomeOscillator();
376​
377 // -------------------------------------------------------------
378 // Logic Step 2: Execution
379 //
380 // [Why] (Intent)
381 // Process the candle data through the calculation method.
382 // -------------------------------------------------------------
383 ao.Calculate(candles);
384​
385 // -------------------------------------------------------------
386 // Logic Step 3: Extraction
387 //
388 // [Why] (Intent)
389 // Return the calculated AO values directly.
390 // -------------------------------------------------------------
391 return ao.Values;
392 }
393 }
394}
python_simple:
1class AwesomeOscillator:
2 """
3 Awesome Oscillator (AO)
4 Market momentum indicator.
5 AO = SMA(Median, 5) - SMA(Median, 34)
6 """
7 def __init__(self):
8 self.fast_period = 5
9 self.slow_period = 34
10 self.values = []
11​
12 def calculate(self, candles):
13 self.values.clear()
14 if len(candles) == 0: return
15​
16 medians = [(c['high'] + c['low']) / 2.0 for c in candles]
17​
18 for i in range(len(candles)):
19 if i < self.slow_period - 1:
20 self.values.append(None)
21 continue
22
23 sum_fast = sum(medians[i-self.fast_period+1 : i+1])
24 sum_slow = sum(medians[i-self.slow_period+1 : i+1])
25
26 sma_fast = sum_fast / self.fast_period
27 sma_slow = sum_slow / self.slow_period
28
29 self.values.append(sma_fast - sma_slow)
30​
31def calculate(candles):
32 ao = AwesomeOscillator()
33 ao.calculate(candles)
34 return ao.values
python_detailed:
1# =============================================================================
2# Logic Breakdown (AwesomeOscillator - AO)
3# =============================================================================
4#
5# This document provides a "Deep Dive" into the internal logic of the
6# Awesome Oscillator. We explain *why* code is written this way and
7# *how* data transforms line-by-line, targeting programming beginners.
8#
9# [Core Concepts]
10# 1. Median Price
11# AO uses (High + Low) / 2 instead of Close.
12# This represents the "fair value" of each bar,
13# ignoring open/close artificiality.
14#
15# 2. Dual SMA Momentum
16# AO = SMA(5, Median) - SMA(34, Median)
17# Fast SMA - Slow SMA = Momentum
18# Same concept as MACD but with median price.
19#
20# 3. Bill Williams Trading System
21# AO is part of Bill Williams' trading methodology.
22# Used with Accelerator Oscillator (AC) for confirmation.
23#
24# [Trading Signals]
25# - AO > 0: Bullish momentum
26# - AO < 0: Bearish momentum
27# - AO crossing zero: Trend change
28# - "Saucer": Three consecutive bars forming a bowl shape
29#
30# =============================================================================
31​
32​
33# -------------------------------------------------------------
34# Type-Level Explanation: AwesomeOscillator (class)
35#
36# [Why] Simple calculation with fixed periods (Bill Williams' spec).
37# Class constants define the 5/34 SMA periods.
38#
39# [What] Computes momentum as difference between fast and slow SMA
40# of median prices.
41#
42# [Who] Bill Williams system traders, momentum analysts.
43#
44# [Where] Heap allocation - stores result list.
45#
46# Why fixed periods (5 and 34)?
47# These are Bill Williams' original parameters.
48# 5 is a Fibonacci number, 34 is also Fibonacci.
49# Not configurable by design (part of the "system").
50# -------------------------------------------------------------
51class AwesomeOscillator:
52​
53 # -------------------------------------------------------------
54 # Class Constants: FAST_PERIOD, SLOW_PERIOD
55 #
56 # [Role]
57 # Fixed periods per Bill Williams' specification.
58 # FAST_PERIOD = 5: Responsive to recent price changes
59 # SLOW_PERIOD = 34: Represents longer-term trend
60 #
61 # [Type Choice]
62 # Class-level int constants (not instance variables).
63 # All instances share the same values.
64 # -------------------------------------------------------------
65 FAST_PERIOD = 5
66 SLOW_PERIOD = 34
67​
68 # -------------------------------------------------------------
69 # Constructor: __init__
70 #
71 # [Why] No parameters needed - periods are fixed.
72 # Just initialize the result container.
73 # -------------------------------------------------------------
74 def __init__(self):
75 self.values = []
76​
77​
78 # =============================================================================
79 # IPO: calculate
80 # =============================================================================
81 #
82 # [Input]
83 # - candles: list[dict] - Each dict has 'high', 'low' keys.
84 #
85 # [Process]
86 # 1. Calculate median prices: (high + low) / 2
87 # 2. For each bar with enough history:
88 # a. Calculate 5-period SMA of median prices
89 # b. Calculate 34-period SMA of median prices
90 # c. AO = Fast SMA - Slow SMA
91 #
92 # [Output]
93 # - None (results stored in self.values)
94 # =============================================================================
95 def calculate(self, candles):
96​
97 # -------------------------------------------------------------
98 # Logic Step 1: State Reset
99 # -------------------------------------------------------------
100 self.values.clear()
101​
102 # -------------------------------------------------------------
103 # Logic Step 2: Empty Input Guard
104 # -------------------------------------------------------------
105 if len(candles) == 0:
106 return
107​
108 # -------------------------------------------------------------
109 # Logic Step 3: Calculate Median Prices
110 #
111 # [Why] (Intent)
112 # Median price = (High + Low) / 2 is Bill Williams' standard.
113 # Unlike Close, median price represents the "center" of the bar.
114 #
115 # [How] (Logic)
116 # List comprehension for O(N) single-pass transformation.
117 #
118 # [Visual]
119 # candle: {high: 105, low: 95}
120 # median = (105 + 95) / 2 = 100
121 # -------------------------------------------------------------
122 midpoints = [(c['high'] + c['low']) / 2 for c in candles]
123​
124 # -------------------------------------------------------------
125 # Logic Step 4: Main Calculation Loop
126 #
127 # [Why] (Intent)
128 # Calculate AO for each bar with sufficient history.
129 #
130 # [How] (Logic)
131 # For each bar, calculate fast and slow SMA, then subtract.
132 # Using simple sum/period for each SMA.
133 #
134 # Note: This is O(N × SLOW_PERIOD) - could be optimized with
135 # sliding window, but kept simple for clarity.
136 #
137 # [Visual]
138 # SLOW_PERIOD = 34
139 # i < 33: None (need 34 bars for slow SMA)
140 # i = 33: First valid AO
141 #
142 # midpoints: [100, 101, 99, 102, 103, ...]
143 #
144 # At i = 33:
145 # Fast SMA = (midpoints[29] + ... + midpoints[33]) / 5
146 # Slow SMA = (midpoints[0] + ... + midpoints[33]) / 34
147 # AO = Fast SMA - Slow SMA
148 # -------------------------------------------------------------
149 for i in range(len(candles)):
150​
151 # -------------------------------------------------------------
152 # Logic Step 4.1: Insufficient History Check
153 #
154 # [Decision]
155 # Do we have enough bars for the Slow SMA (34 periods)?
156 #
157 # [True Branch: Skip]
158 # Append None. We can't calculate AO yet.
159 #
160 # [False Branch: Calculate]
161 # Proceed to SMA calculation.
162 # -------------------------------------------------------------
163 if i < self.SLOW_PERIOD - 1:
164 self.values.append(None)
165 continue
166​
167 # -------------------------------------------------------------
168 # Logic Step 4.2: Calculate Fast SMA
169 #
170 # [How] (Logic)
171 # Sum the most recent FAST_PERIOD median prices.
172 # Using generator expression with range.
173 #
174 # [Visual]
175 # i = 40, FAST_PERIOD = 5
176 # j = 0: midpoints[40 - 0] = midpoints[40]
177 # j = 1: midpoints[40 - 1] = midpoints[39]
178 # ...
179 # j = 4: midpoints[40 - 4] = midpoints[36]
180 # Sum of [36..40], divide by 5
181 # -------------------------------------------------------------
182 sum_fast = sum(midpoints[i - j] for j in range(self.FAST_PERIOD))
183​
184 # -------------------------------------------------------------
185 # Logic Step 4.3: Calculate Slow SMA
186 #
187 # [How] (Logic)
188 # Sum the most recent SLOW_PERIOD median prices.
189 #
190 # [Visual]
191 # i = 40, SLOW_PERIOD = 34
192 # Sum of midpoints[7..40], divide by 34
193 # -------------------------------------------------------------
194 sum_slow = sum(midpoints[i - j] for j in range(self.SLOW_PERIOD))
195​
196 # -------------------------------------------------------------
197 # Logic Step 4.4: Calculate AO
198 #
199 # [Why] (Intent)
200 # Difference between fast and slow SMA shows momentum.
201 # Positive = bullish, Negative = bearish.
202 #
203 # [How] (Logic)
204 # AO = Fast SMA - Slow SMA
205 #
206 # [Visual]
207 # Fast SMA = 102.5 (recent prices rising)
208 # Slow SMA = 100.0 (longer-term baseline)
209 # AO = 102.5 - 100.0 = +2.5 (bullish momentum)
210 # -------------------------------------------------------------
211 self.values.append(sum_fast / self.FAST_PERIOD - sum_slow / self.SLOW_PERIOD)
212​
213​
214# =============================================================================
215# Static Wrapper Function: calculate
216# =============================================================================
217#
218# [Why]
219# Provides functional API for one-shot calculations.
220# No parameters needed - AO uses fixed periods.
221#
222# [Pattern: 3-Step Static Wrapper]
223# =============================================================================
224def calculate(candles):
225 # 1. Instantiation
226 ao = AwesomeOscillator()
227​
228 # 2. Execution
229 ao.calculate(candles)
230​
231 # 3. Extraction
232 return ao.values
